comment: A very kind lady, but not helpful. You would ask her a question for clarification on part of an assignment, and she'd tell you everything but the answer. SO MUCH HOMEWORK, it was never-ending. She also would expect you to meet up with your group outside of class at least once a week, but we were all commuters and it was physically impossible.

Dr. Callahan is very nice but her grading is unnecessarily tough. There were times when she would contradict herself by telling me that something was right in class but then she would grade it, and the feedback would say it was wrong. It was like she graded really harshly for fun. Friends who took this class with another professor said it was easy.

Nothing was organized, she would announce an assignment the day it was due and expect it done by that night.  Her directions were very unclear and she doesn't answer questions directly. This was the most poorly put together class and the in class activities were in no way related to the work. expected us to meet outside of class time every week.

She was really nice and understanding, but there's so many projects and if you are set up with a bad group, you just have to deal with us. For one of the projects I had to do the whole poster, five page research project, and presenting by myself and she told me there was nothing she could do, I cried for days because of how much work there is.

GROUPWORK. thats the one word i would use to describe this class. She doesnt care if you have a bad group and expects you to still turn assignments in. Hearing from friends who had a different teacher, this class would be easy but not with Callhan Shes super sweet dont get me wrong but this class is so pointless and required for my major MISERABLE.

Dr. Callahan is a very nice lady, however, I highly recommend not taking this class. Her explanations are awful, her grading system makes no sense, even the assignments are really nonsensical, and unnecessary. If you ask her for help, she'll be quick to simply tell you it's on D2L and that you're on your own. I'm warning you, do NOT take her class.

if you can take any other professor for scm2000 do it. she's an extremely hard grader and none of her advice is helpful. the class is 90% group work and you cant pick your team and cant switch. this was supposed to be my easiest class but made me so stressed all semester because of her grading and having many assignments due at the same time.

You need to prepare for group projects as well as public speaking. This class is project and writing heavy as you will complete an academic essay and multiple mini-projects. Attendance is mandatory! Overall, she is very considerate and gives great feedback as well as multiple attempts to better your grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Overall Callahan was a nice teacher. She was very sweet and cared for her students. However, the amount of unnecessary work that was given, that literal middle schooler could do, was unbearable. There were multipule times in the semester where I contimplated driving to her class without a seatbelt because it would be better than attending her class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: She is very sweet and kind to all of her students but this class was aggravating with all the assignments given especially with them being group projects. Outside of class, she is very gentle and gives good study tips
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Callahan takes this class very seriously and grades extremely tough for what the work is, BUT if you work with her, youll do well. She is always willing to accept late or redone assignments. She was even super patient with me when i was anxious about presenting. I give her 4 stars because of her tough grading.

She sets you up for failure. Let's just say if your group happens to ditch you last minute for a project she won't help you out. And this class heavily consists of group work. I dropped this course and thankfully I wasn't dropped from the other two courses in my learning community. So much frustration with her and the worst professor I've had yet.

The class was difficult and keep me busy from my other classes. The class was both in person and online but if you couldnt make it in person she didnt care. Outside of class she was difficult to reach and when she replied it was very bland and you had to ask multiple questions multiple times to get an answer. I do not recommend her.

I couldnt believe how difficult her class was! As a full-time freshman this was the class that constantly kept me busy. Definitely my least favorite class. She is a nice professor though it seemed fake. On top of that she graded harshly when her directions for assignments were vague. Heavily consisted of group projects. Freshman beware!

I was surprised to see that she has a lot of bad reviews on here because she is so sweet! She is a bit of a tough grader but she is very understanding about late work and re-submitting assignments. I was very anxious about a presentation and she let me record it instead. Lots of group work so make sure to be ready to participate.

Hating this class is an understatement. She took this class very seriously. Graded pretty harsh when stuff was quite simple. Kind of fake tbh. Lectures were boring. She's not mean exactly just not understanding and she did too much most of the time. If I could go back to freshman orientation and change one thing, it'd be her

This was the hardest class Ive EVER taken. This is coming from someone who took AP chemistry in high school. The comments she makes on your graded material dont make any sense and you can easily receive a 50/100 because youre too vague, when she is the most vague person on the planet. Freshman do NOT take her find someone else ! Please
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Don't take her for seminar. She is nice but overall she grades really harshly and gives very vague directions for everything, setting you up for a bad grade. If you ask her a questions you will often be left with even more questions than a good answer.

She took KSU 1101 very seriously. As a full time student, her freshman seminar class overloaded me with busy work. My other classes suffered because I had to spend so much time on assignments for this class. Do your work and you'll pass. Allows you to make up for missed classes.

I learned more from Googling the concepts than I did in the waste of an hour and 15 minutes twice a week. She has no control over the class. We spent more time arguing amongst ourselves than we did learning anything useful. She seems to have her thoughts together, but it doesn't translate to words. I would highly recommend finding an alternative.

She was a great math professor. Class was hard and it was important to pay attention. I learned a lot and have learned several ways to teach my future students. During class it may be hard to relate to how you will use information as a teacher but good class overall.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Sweet lady but a hard grader. Her tests seem simple until you get your grade back. Her explanations as to why you get an answer wrong are vague. I was looking over a quiz & I said a circle is not a polygon b/c a polygon consists of straight lines & a circle doesn't have any straight lines. She marked it wrong & asked, "how do you know?" WHAT EVEN?!

I really liked Dr. Callahan. Yes the class was increddibly difficult, and there were times I thought I was going to drop it. But I can honestly say I learned so much in this class and its because of this type of class that I was able to answer all math questions on the GACE and get a 100%.

This is the single worst teacher I've ever had. She's very vague on her instructions but then counts off MAJOR points for not being overly specific in papers and on tests. Lots of pop quiz type assignments. My advice to you: take this class somewhere else. She's the only option at KSU. Do a transient semester and take it elsewhere or fail.

Many people change from math ed to just a math major after stepping foot into this class.  She grinds a hard grind, but the way she makes you think about problems is very helpful for when you're a teacher.  However, the material learned is minimal, and it is super hard to get an A due to her super specific grading and vague feedback.

Dr. Callahan is truly a tough teacher. But she is also very nice and helpful when you ask her for help. She constantly stayed late or got to class early to work specifically with students who were having trouble keeping up. Anyone who says Dr. Callahan is not a nice person misunderstands her tough persona as being mean spirited.

I read the reviews on here before taking her class and they are 100% true! I have never worked so hard to get awful grades. EXTREMELY picky on what you say in quizzes and in class. She makes the whole class confused and doesn't explain why or ever really teach. Prepare to teach yourself with 0 help from her.

She's vague--but she'll mark you wrong for being vague. She's not that much help in the classroom. Quizzes are nothing like class lectures. You get points taken off for technology use during class, there's no attendance policy but the EQ's are unpredictable. She eventually became unapproachable for me and I was on my own. Avoid her if you can.

I would avoid this professor at all cost. Did not teach a single thing all semester. Has no communication skills, rude, hateful, clearly doesn't like people in general. Sadly, it you do pass, you will learn nothing!  Students were crying and angry all semeste; never seen that befor!

Dr. Callahan pushes her students to learn ON THEIR OWN. She does no guidance whatsoever. There are 3 tough essays. Quizzes are real hard. Textbook is pointless. Attendance is not mandatory, but she makes us do IQ's for a grade. Goodluck!

You will cry at least once during this class. Like serious life reevaluating, i want to crawl in a hole type tears. This is probably the most frustrating class I have ever taken in my life and if you do not have the magic math touch do not expect to get great grades. Professor is helpful, but the class is just challenging.

The reviews on here are absolutely true. If you have a good GPA, find another professor.  No compassion. Never friendly.  You will be lost most of the time.  You will not like the class. 3 MATH papers!! and graded hard. Instructional method is terrible. Prepare to be very frustrated.  I would make this an absolute last resort. Seriously awful.

She is a horrible teacher. Everyone in the class is completely confused everyday. She won't answer questions but tries to let us struggle through it and that isn't productive at all. Really tough grader. Avoid taking her!!

Expect to work HARD for your grade. Dr Callahan can be intimidating but if she sees that you're trying your hardest she's willing to help, if asked. Grading of seperate assignments didn't seem fair but the grading system for the overall class grade was. Hope that makes sense. If you want a challenge take her. I got a B and worked hard for it!
If you are looking for an easy A this is not the class! She is helpful outside of class but you will write papers and have alot of projects

I am a Math major. I had a 4.0 before taking this class. I was given a B. I had an A easily going into the final project. My opinion is that her grading is HIGHLY subjective, and inconsistent. If you take her, good luck, you will need it. If you have a 4.0 think carefully. Consider the alternate professor for Summer Semester.
RUN from this class!!! When you ask for help she tries to help you but still fails you on EVERYTHING! If you can not think out of the box then you will be Very confused!

Dr. Callahan is VERY intimidating at first, but gets better. Projects are graded hard. If you follow the steps & include what she asks of you, you'll have no problems. Homework is nonexistant (i never did it) and there are 5 quizzes, lowest 1 dropped. She likes to make you 'figure it out on your own' but will help if you just don't get it.
This class is kinda difficult to gage but she is very fair in her grading and reasonable. I would take her again.

Do not walk, RUN from this professor. Took her twice out of necessity and it was the biggest mistake of my academic career. The tests/projects DO NOT reflect what is taught in class. She is the most ridiculous grader on every project. Ask around, you will see.
I got frustrated at times because she waits for everyone in the class to understand. She was a good professor and I am taking her for maymester too.

Great math teacher. Doesn't explain things well in class because she wants you to figure out things on your own. her class is very easy but she is a very picky grader! take her you will learn something.

Be sure to explain EVERYTHING & pay EXTREME attention to detail. She is a very picky grader. Some parts in her tests can be slightly harder than how she teaches in class, so practice a lot & you'll be fine. She is good overall because she teaches you to pay really close attention to every single detail & that's a good quality for teachers to have.

Run for your life!!!  The professor is nice, but she is not clear until you get a F on your work.  Then you ask her again, "What did I do wrong?" She will explain it again.  I understood what she said a little, but this class hurt my self-esteem about Math.  I passed the class.
Specific grader but never gave specifics. tests never matched up to what she taught in class as far as difficulty level. Big knock at my confidence as far as math goes.

Attendance not mandatory, but she has EQ's that count for points that she uses and you can't get the points if you aren't there. Can be very unclear on tests and quizzes but think out of the box and youll be okay. Explain EVERY TINY DETAIL on tests and quizzes. I took her for 2 courses and there is always someone very upset with the way she grades.

If you are not an "out of the box" thinker, you will HATE this class.. Confusing on what exactly Dr. Callahan wants from you, but class always flew by.  You can plan on talking over one question for a whole class period.  PARTICIPATION ABSOLUTE MUST!

It was a picture of a constructivist learning style.  The only problem was some people seemed to have a very small base to build on.  It was a terrible class, I still have no idea what she wanted and I made an A go figure.  The class argues at length and she gets mad when you tune it out, talking down to some.  I made an A and learned little.Thanks

I really enjoyed this class and Dr. Callahan.  I love the way she teaches.  She won't just tell you the answer but she makes you figure it out.  She also brings up the perspective of a student which is the most important thing in our major! Take her if you can!

Participation is neccessary!  If you don't participate, you will not get an A.  There's only one exam, so be prepared.  This class is not easy, but it's not that hard either.  Dr. Callahan is very responsive on email, and willing to help if you reach out to her.  Attendance is mandantory, but there are usually opportunities to earn points in class.

This has been one of my hardest classes thus far and it shouldn't have been...it's fractions! She doesn't really let you know her expectations and when you ask questions she just kinda looks at you while you talk to your self to figure it out. I would not recommend her to my worst enemy. Very strict attendance policy
Easy class; Grade is out of 400 points (100 for each: participation, EQs, takehome midterm, final storybook project). Does not actually teach, but leads class in discussion

I would def NOT reccommend her. She does not teach, she makes your classmates teach. If you are confused about a question she will just say "hmmm, or what do you think?". If I knew, I would not be asking her for help. I like teachers who teach. I am most likely going to end the class with an A but that is b/c working in groups help me out.

If you love math and don't feel like you need much guidance, then feel free to take Callahan. However, I did do well, but I would not recommend her. She does not give feedback on problems in class, she pretty much lets the class teach itself. If you're struggling with fractions she does not go over things well and hardly teaches.
Awesome!

Good professor.  If you don't like critical thinking, then you may not enjoy this class.  I have truly enjoyed this class.  Teacher is helpful.  However, try to get a used book if possible because the expense is not worth it. Enjoy!
